list.name: Changes
list.comment:
feat: Add MkDocs documentation site and bump version script
**New Features:**
- **MkDocs Site:** A comprehensive documentation site has been created under the `docs/` and `site/` directories. This includes: - `mkdocs.yml`: The main configuration file for the site, defining the theme, navigation, and plugins. - Markdown pages for "Getting Started," "Contributing," "Changelog," and detailed API references for primitives, objects, collections, and other validation types. - Static assets including CSS for custom styling and all necessary JavaScript bundles for the Material theme.
- **`bump-version.sh` script:** - A new shell script in the `scripts/` directory automates updating the `library.version` in `gradle.properties`, committing the change, and creating a corresponding Git tag.
**Documentation Content Added:** - `index.md`: Main landing page for the documentation. - `getting-started.md`: Installation and basic usage guide. - `advanced-usage.md`: Covers more complex topics like error handling. - API reference pages for: `collections.md`, `enums.md`, `intersections.md`, `objects.md`, `primitives.md`, `refinements.md`, `transformations.md`, and `unions.md`. - `changelog.md`: A manually maintained changelog. - `contributing.md` & `license.md`: Project contribution guidelines and license information.
**New Scripts:**
- `scripts/bump-version.sh`: For version management. - `scripts/setup_docs.sh`: To install MkDocs and its dependencies. - `scripts/prepareJitpackEnvironment.sh`: To set environment variables for JitPack builds.

project.component: { "keyToString": { "Android App.ZodKmpApp.composeApp.executor": "Run", "Android App.composeApp.executor": "Run", "Gradle.Building Kotlin artifacts for Build :composeApp:embedAndSignAppleFrameworkForXcode.executor": "Run", "ModuleVcsDetector.initialDetectionPerformed": "true", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.cidr.known.project.marker": "true", "RunOnceActivity.git.unshallow": "true", "RunOnceActivity.readMode.enableVisualFormatting": "true", "Xcode Application.iosApp.executor": "Run", "cf.first.check.clang-format": "false", "cidr.known.project.marker": "true", "dart.analysis.tool.window.visible": "false", "git-widget-placeholder": "gh-pages", "last_opened_file_path": "/Users/mehedihassanpiash/Documents/OpenSource/zodkmp/composeApp/src/wasmJsMain/resources", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "preferences.fileTypes", "show.migrate.to.gradle.popup": "false" } }

task.summary: Default task

feat: Implement comprehensive validation schemas and UI
This commit introduces a wide range of validation schemas to the ZodKmp library, significantly expanding its capabilities. It also includes a modern Compose UI example (`ZodKmpModernExample.kt`) to demonstrate these new features.
New validation schemas added: - `ZodArray`: Validates arrays with element-specific schemas and constraints like min/max length. - `ZodDate`: Validates date values, supporting parsing from strings and min/max date constraints. - `ZodDefault`: Provides default values for schemas when input is null/undefined. - `ZodEnum`: Validates values against a predefined set of enum-like options. - `ZodIntersection`: Validates that input satisfies multiple schemas simultaneously. - `ZodLiteral`: Validates that input matches a specific literal value. - `ZodNull`: Validates that input is explicitly null. - `ZodNullable`: Allows a schema to accept null values in addition to its defined type. - `ZodRecord`: Validates objects with string keys and values of a specific type. - `ZodRefinement`: Allows adding custom validation logic (refinements) to existing schemas. - `ZodTransform`: Transforms the validated value into a different type or format. - `ZodTuple`: Validates fixed-length arrays (tuples) with specific types for each element. - `ZodUndefined`: Validates that input is undefined (represented as null in Kotlin). - `ZodUnion`: Validates that input matches at least one of several provided schemas.
The `Zod.kt` entry point has been updated to include factory methods for these new schemas.
The `composeApp` module now features `ZodKmpModernExample.kt`, a comprehensive UI built with Jetpack Compose Material 3. This example showcases various validation scenarios using the new schemas, organized into "Basic," "Advanced," and "Transform" sections. It replaces the older `MainView.kt`.
Dependencies: - Added `kotlinx-datetime` for date validation capabilities.
Removed: - `MainView.kt` (replaced by `ZodKmpModernExample.kt`) - `User.kt` (no longer used in the example)

feat: Implement comprehensive validation schemas and UI
This commit introduces a wide range of validation schemas to the ZodKmp library, significantly expanding its capabilities. It also includes a modern Compose UI example (`ZodKmpModernExample.kt`) to demonstrate these new features.
New validation schemas added: - `ZodArray`: Validates arrays with element-specific schemas and constraints like min/max length. - `ZodDate`: Validates date values, supporting parsing from strings and min/max date constraints. - `ZodDefault`: Provides default values for schemas when input is null/undefined. - `ZodEnum`: Validates values against a predefined set of enum-like options. - `ZodIntersection`: Validates that input satisfies multiple schemas simultaneously. - `ZodLiteral`: Validates that input matches a specific literal value. - `ZodNull`: Validates that input is explicitly null. - `ZodNullable`: Allows a schema to accept null values in addition to its defined type. - `ZodRecord`: Validates objects with string keys and values of a specific type. - `ZodRefinement`: Allows adding custom validation logic (refinements) to existing schemas. - `ZodTransform`: Transforms the validated value into a different type or format. - `ZodTuple`: Validates fixed-length arrays (tuples) with specific types for each element. - `ZodUndefined`: Validates that input is undefined (represented as null in Kotlin). - `ZodUnion`: Validates that input matches at least one of several provided schemas.
The `Zod.kt` entry point has been updated to include factory methods for these new schemas.
The `composeApp` module now features `ZodKmpModernExample.kt`, a comprehensive UI built with Jetpack Compose Material 3. This example showcases various validation scenarios using the new schemas, organized into "Basic," "Advanced," and "Transform" sections. It replaces the older `MainView.kt`.
Dependencies: - Added `kotlinx-datetime` for date validation capabilities.
Removed: - `MainView.kt` (replaced by `ZodKmpModernExample.kt`) - `User.kt` (no longer used in the example)

- Multiplatform Support: Properly configured for Android, iOS and other KMP targets - Security: Uses environment variables for credentials and signing keys - Metadata: Complete POM metadata with proper license, developers, and SCM information - CI/CD Integration: Automated publishing via GitHub Actions - Local Testing: Configured to allow local testing of the publishing process

feat: Enhance publishing process and documentation
This commit significantly improves the publishing process for Maven Central and updates the related documentation.
Key changes:
Build Configuration (`build.gradle.kts` and `zodkmp/build.gradle.kts`): - Changed `group` from `com.piashcse.zodkmp` to `io.github.piashcse` in the root `build.gradle.kts`. - Added global `repositories` configuration for `google()` and `mavenCentral()`. - Introduced a new Gradle task `bumpVersion` to update `library.version` in `gradle.properties`. - Added Javadoc and sources JAR generation (`javadocJar`, `allSourcesJar`) in `zodkmp/build.gradle.kts` for Maven Central compliance. - Ensured consistent `artifactId` ("zodkmp") for iOS publications. - Added `distribution.set("repo")` to the license information in POM. - Added organization details (`piashcse`, `https://github.com/piashcse`) to developer information in POM. - Included a "Snapshot" repository configuration for Sonatype OSSRH.
README (`README.md`): - Updated the group ID in dependency examples from `com.piashcse.zodkmp` to `io.github.piashcse`. - Expanded the "Publishing to Maven Central" section with detailed prerequisites, automated release process using GitHub Actions, verification steps, and manual publishing instructions.
GitHub Workflows: - Added a new workflow `release.yml` for creating GitHub releases. This workflow: - Takes version, release title, and body as inputs. - Updates `library.version` in `gradle.properties`. - Commits version changes. - Creates and pushes a Git tag. - Creates a GitHub release. - Modified `publish.yml` workflow: - Triggers on push to tags matching `v*` (in addition to `workflow_dispatch`). - Added an input for `version` for manual dispatch. - Extracts the version from the Git tag if not provided as input. - Updates `library.version` in `gradle.properties` using the extracted or input version before publishing.
fix: Disable signing for JitPack builds

refactor: Simplify Maven Central publishing with vanniktech plugin
This commit refactors the publishing process to Maven Central by replacing the manual `maven-publish` and `signing` configuration with the `com.vanniktech.maven.publish` plugin. This significantly simplifies the build scripts and standardizes the process.
Key changes: - **Replaced Manual Publishing:** Removed the extensive manual configuration for `maven-publish`, `signing`, Javadoc/sources JAR creation, and repository definitions from `zodkmp/build.gradle.kts`. - **Adopted Vanniktech Plugin:** Added `com.vanniktech.maven.publish` plugin to `libs.versions.toml` and applied it in `zodkmp/build.gradle.kts`. - **Externalized Configuration:** All POM metadata and library coordinates (group, version, artifactId, developer info, SCM, etc.) are now defined in `gradle.properties` and read dynamically in the build script. This makes configuration more centralized and easier to manage. - **Simplified CI/CD:** The `.github/workflows/publish.yml` workflow is updated to trigger on GitHub releases. It now uses a single command, `./gradlew publishToMavenCentral`, and relies on environment variables prefixed with `ORG_GRADLE_PROJECT_` for credentials, as recommended by the vanniktech plugin. - **Updated Documentation:** The `README.md` has been updated to reflect the new, simpler publishing process, including changes to required GitHub secrets and local verification commands.

refactor: Configure Maven Central publishing coordinates
This commit updates the `build.gradle.kts` file to explicitly configure the publishing settings for Maven Central using the `vanniktech.maven.publish` plugin.
Key changes: - Added `publishToMavenCentral()` to target the Maven Central repository. - Defined the artifact coordinates (`artifactId` and `version`) for the project, allowing them to be sourced from Gradle properties.

feat: Expand multiplatform support
This commit significantly expands the range of supported targets for the `zodkmp` library, enhancing its cross-platform capabilities.
Support has been added for the following platforms: - **JVM**: `desktop` - **JavaScript**: `js` (browser and nodejs) and `wasmJs` - **iOS**: `iosX64` for simulators on Intel Macs - **macOS**: `macosX64` and `macosArm64` - **tvOS**: `tvosArm64`, `tvosX64`, and `tvosSimulatorArm64` - **watchOS**: `watchosArm32`, `watchosArm64`, `watchosX64`, and `watchosSimulatorArm64` - **Linux**: `linuxX64` and `linuxArm64` - **Windows**: `mingwX64`

chore: Bump version to 1.1.0
This commit updates the project version from 1.0.0 to 1.1.0.
Specifically, the following files have been changed: - `gradle.properties`: The `library.version` is set to `1.1.0`. - `README.md`: The usage examples in the documentation are updated to reflect the new version `1.1.0`.
Code optimization

docs: Update README and project metadata
### README.md - **Badges**: Added a Maven Central badge and more specific platform badges. - **Coordinates**: Updated the Gradle dependency coordinates from `com.piashcse.zodkmp:zodkmp:1.0.0` to `io.github.piashcse:zodkmp:1.1.0`. - **Structure**: Reorganized sections for better readability, moving `Platform Support` and `Installation` to the top. - **Content**: Added a "Developed By" section with author information and expanded the `License` section to include the full MIT license text.
### gradle.properties - **Description**: Updated `POM_DESCRIPTION` to provide a more detailed and descriptive summary of the library's purpose.
refactor: Shorten app bar title

feat: Add comprehensive tests for all validation schemas
This commit introduces a complete test suite for the ZodKmp library, ensuring the correctness and reliability of all existing validation schemas. Test files have been added for each schema type, covering a wide range of scenarios including successful parsing, failure cases, and specific validation rules.
**Key tests added:** - `ZodArrayTest`: Validates array schema with tests for element types, `min`, `max`, and `length`. - `ZodBooleanTest`: Tests boolean parsing, including case-insensitive strings and `isEqual` checks. - `ZodDateTest`: Verifies parsing of `LocalDateTime` objects and date/time strings, plus `min`/`max` constraints. - `ZodDefaultTest`: Ensures default values are correctly applied for `null` inputs. - `ZodEnumTest`: Checks validation against a predefined set of values. - `ZodIntersectionTest`: Tests that input satisfies multiple schemas simultaneously. - `ZodLiteralTest`: Verifies that input matches a specific literal value. - `ZodNullTest`: Confirms that only `null` values are accepted. - `ZodNullableTest`: Ensures schemas correctly handle `null` in addition to their defined type. - `ZodNumberTest`: Covers number parsing, `min`/`max`, `int`, `positive`, and `negative` checks. - `ZodObjectTest`: Validates object shape, type correctness, strict mode, and optional fields. - `ZodOptionalTest`: Confirms that schemas correctly handle optional (`null`) values. - `ZodRecordTest`: Tests validation for maps with string keys and typed values. - `ZodRefinementTest`: Verifies custom validation logic on top of existing schemas. - `ZodStringTest`: Includes tests for `min`/`max`/`length`, `email`, `url`, and `regex` validations. - `ZodTransformTest`: Ensures data transformation logic is applied correctly after validation. - `ZodTupleTest`: Validates fixed-length arrays with specific types for each element. - `ZodUndefinedTest`: Confirms that only `null` (representing `undefined`) is accepted. - `ZodUnionTest`: Tests that input matches at least one of several provided schemas.
These tests cover both `parse` (throwing exceptions on failure) and `safeParse` (returning a `ZodResult`) methods for each schema, providing robust coverage for the library's core functionality.

feat: Add more validation rules for String, Number, and Array schemas
**ZodString:** - New validation methods: `startsWith`, `endsWith`, and `includes`.
**ZodNumber:** - New validation methods: `nonPositive`, `nonNegative`, and `range`. - **Fix:** The `int()` validation now correctly checks for whole numbers using the modulo operator (`num % 1 != 0.0`) instead of `num != num.toLong().toDouble()`.
**ZodArray:** - New validation methods: `nonEmpty` and `unique`.
All new features are accompanied by comprehensive tests in `ZodStringTest.kt`, `ZodNumberTest.kt`, and `ZodArrayTest.kt`. Additionally, tests in `ZodTupleTest.kt` and `ZodIntersectionTest.kt` have been updated for stricter type safety and to remove redundant assertions.

chore: Remove tvOS and watchOS targets and bump version
- The library version has been updated from 1.1.0 to 1.2.0.
Update README.md

feat: Add example support for Desktop and Web (WASM)
**Desktop Support:** - A `desktop` source set has been added with its own platform-specific implementation. - The entry point `main.kt` is configured to launch a Compose for Desktop window, which displays the existing `ZodKmpModernExample`. - The Gradle build is updated to configure the desktop application, including the main class and native distribution formats (`.dmg`, `.msi`, `.deb`).
**Web (WASM) Support:** - The experimental Compose for Web (WASM) target (`wasmJs`) has been enabled in `gradle.properties`. - A `wasmJs` source set is introduced, containing the platform implementation and the `main.kt` entry point that renders the `App` within a `ComposeViewport`. - Basic web resources (`index.html`, `styles.css`) have been added to host the WASM application. - Webpack is configured to output `composeApp.js`.

**New Scripts:**
- `scripts/bump-version.sh`: For version management. - `scripts/setup_docs.sh`: To install MkDocs and its dependencies. - `scripts/prepareJitpackEnvironment.sh`: To set environment variables for JitPack builds.

feat: Implement comprehensive validation schemas and UI
This commit introduces a wide range of validation schemas to the ZodKmp library, significantly expanding its capabilities. It also includes a modern Compose UI example (`ZodKmpModernExample.kt`) to demonstrate these new features.
New validation schemas added: - `ZodArray`: Validates arrays with element-specific schemas and constraints like min/max length. - `ZodDate`: Validates date values, supporting parsing from strings and min/max date constraints. - `ZodDefault`: Provides default values for schemas when input is null/undefined. - `ZodEnum`: Validates values against a predefined set of enum-like options. - `ZodIntersection`: Validates that input satisfies multiple schemas simultaneously. - `ZodLiteral`: Validates that input matches a specific literal value. - `ZodNull`: Validates that input is explicitly null. - `ZodNullable`: Allows a schema to accept null values in addition to its defined type. - `ZodRecord`: Validates objects with string keys and values of a specific type. - `ZodRefinement`: Allows adding custom validation logic (refinements) to existing schemas. - `ZodTransform`: Transforms the validated value into a different type or format. - `ZodTuple`: Validates fixed-length arrays (tuples) with specific types for each element. - `ZodUndefined`: Validates that input is undefined (represented as null in Kotlin). - `ZodUnion`: Validates that input matches at least one of several provided schemas.
The `Zod.kt` entry point has been updated to include factory methods for these new schemas.
The `composeApp` module now features `ZodKmpModernExample.kt`, a comprehensive UI built with Jetpack Compose Material 3. This example showcases various validation scenarios using the new schemas, organized into "Basic," "Advanced," and "Transform" sections. It replaces the older `MainView.kt`.
Dependencies: - Added `kotlinx-datetime` for date validation capabilities.
Removed: - `MainView.kt` (replaced by `ZodKmpModernExample.kt`) - `User.kt` (no longer used in the example)

- Multiplatform Support: Properly configured for Android, iOS and other KMP targets - Security: Uses environment variables for credentials and signing keys - Metadata: Complete POM metadata with proper license, developers, and SCM information - CI/CD Integration: Automated publishing via GitHub Actions - Local Testing: Configured to allow local testing of the publishing process

feat: Add more validation rules for String, Number, and Array schemas
**ZodString:** - New validation methods: `startsWith`, `endsWith`, and `includes`.
**ZodNumber:** - New validation methods: `nonPositive`, `nonNegative`, and `range`. - **Fix:** The `int()` validation now correctly checks for whole numbers using the modulo operator (`num % 1 != 0.0`) instead of `num != num.toLong().toDouble()`.
**ZodArray:** - New validation methods: `nonEmpty` and `unique`.
All new features are accompanied by comprehensive tests in `ZodStringTest.kt`, `ZodNumberTest.kt`, and `ZodArrayTest.kt`. Additionally, tests in `ZodTupleTest.kt` and `ZodIntersectionTest.kt` have been updated for stricter type safety and to remove redundant assertions.

chore: Remove tvOS and watchOS targets and bump version
- The library version has been updated from 1.1.0 to 1.2.0.

feat: Add example support for Desktop and Web (WASM)
**Desktop Support:** - A `desktop` source set has been added with its own platform-specific implementation. - The entry point `main.kt` is configured to launch a Compose for Desktop window, which displays the existing `ZodKmpModernExample`. - The Gradle build is updated to configure the desktop application, including the main class and native distribution formats (`.dmg`, `.msi`, `.deb`).
**Web (WASM) Support:** - The experimental Compose for Web (WASM) target (`wasmJs`) has been enabled in `gradle.properties`. - A `wasmJs` source set is introduced, containing the platform implementation and the `main.kt` entry point that renders the `App` within a `ComposeViewport`. - Basic web resources (`index.html`, `styles.css`) have been added to host the WASM application. - Webpack is configured to output `composeApp.js`.

feat: Add MkDocs documentation site and bump version script
**New Features:**
- **MkDocs Site:** A comprehensive documentation site has been created under the `docs/` and `site/` directories. This includes: - `mkdocs.yml`: The main configuration file for the site, defining the theme, navigation, and plugins. - Markdown pages for "Getting Started," "Contributing," "Changelog," and detailed API references for primitives, objects, collections, and other validation types. - Static assets including CSS for custom styling and all necessary JavaScript bundles for the Material theme.
- **`bump-version.sh` script:** - A new shell script in the `scripts/` directory automates updating the `library.version` in `gradle.properties`, committing the change, and creating a corresponding Git tag.
**Documentation Content Added:** - `index.md`: Main landing page for the documentation. - `getting-started.md`: Installation and basic usage guide. - `advanced-usage.md`: Covers more complex topics like error handling. - API reference pages for: `collections.md`, `enums.md`, `intersections.md`, `objects.md`, `primitives.md`, `refinements.md`, `transformations.md`, and `unions.md`. - `changelog.md`: A manually maintained changelog. - `contributing.md` & `license.md`: Project contribution guidelines and license information.
**New Scripts:**
- `scripts/bump-version.sh`: For version management. - `scripts/setup_docs.sh`: To install MkDocs and its dependencies. - `scripts/prepareJitpackEnvironment.sh`: To set environment variables for JitPack builds.

**New Features:**
- **MkDocs Site:** A comprehensive documentation site has been created under the `docs/` and `site/` directories. This includes: - `mkdocs.yml`: The main configuration file for the site, defining the theme, navigation, and plugins. - Markdown pages for "Getting Started," "Contributing," "Changelog," and detailed API references for primitives, objects, collections, and other validation types. - Static assets including CSS for custom styling and all necessary JavaScript bundles for the Material theme.
- **`bump-version.sh` script:** - A new shell script in the `scripts/` directory automates updating the `library.version` in `gradle.properties`, committing the change, and creating a corresponding Git tag.
**Documentation Content Added:** - `index.md`: Main landing page for the documentation. - `getting-started.md`: Installation and basic usage guide. - `advanced-usage.md`: Covers more complex topics like error handling. - API reference pages for: `collections.md`, `enums.md`, `intersections.md`, `objects.md`, `primitives.md`, `refinements.md`, `transformations.md`, and `unions.md`. - `changelog.md`: A manually maintained changelog. - `contributing.md` & `license.md`: Project contribution guidelines and license information.
**New Scripts:**
